content: The final leg of the [serum run to Nome](/wiki/1925_serum_run_to_Nome "1925 serum run to Nome") began as the team of [Gunnar Kaasen](/wiki/Gunnar_Kaasen "Gunnar Kaasen") and lead dog [Balto](/wiki/Balto "Balto") set out from Bluff at 10:00 p.m. into a blizzard.
sources: Aversano, Earl J. ["The 1925 Serum Run to Nome – A Synopsis (Page 3)"](http://www.baltostruestory.net/serumrunsynopsisp3.htm). *Balto's True Story*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: [Ahmed Zog](/wiki/Zog_I_of_Albania "Zog I of Albania") ascended to power in [Albania](/wiki/Albania "Albania"), becoming its [President](/wiki/President_of_Albania "President of Albania"), [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Albania "Prime Minister of Albania") and [Marshal of the Royal Albanian Army](/wiki/Royal_Albanian_Army "Royal Albanian Army").

[Irish President](/wiki/President_of_the_Executive_Council_of_the_Irish_Free_State "President of the Executive Council of the Irish Free State") [W. T. Cosgrave](/wiki/W._T._Cosgrave "W. T. Cosgrave") appealed to the United States for food aid. Ireland's potato crop had been severely curtailed by heavy rainfall the previous summer and autumn.
sources: "Irish Appeal to American for Help in Famine". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 2, 1925. p. 14.

content: [Miguel Paz Barahona](/wiki/Miguel_Paz_Barahona "Miguel Paz Barahona") takes office as [President of Honduras](/wiki/President_of_Honduras "President of Honduras").

[Herma Szabo](/wiki/Herma_Szabo "Herma Szabo") of Austria won the Ladies Competition of the [World Figure Skating Championships](/wiki/1925_World_Figure_Skating_Championships "1925 World Figure Skating Championships") in [Davos](/wiki/Davos "Davos"), Switzerland.

**Born:** [Mary Nesbitt Wisham](/wiki/Mary_Nesbitt_Wisham "Mary Nesbitt Wisham"), baseball player, in [Greenville, South Carolina](/wiki/Greenville,_South_Carolina "Greenville, South Carolina") (d. 2013)

The [serum run](/wiki/1925_serum_run_to_Nome "1925 serum run to Nome") ended successfully as the team of [Gunnar Kaasen](/wiki/Gunnar_Kaasen "Gunnar Kaasen") and lead dog [Balto](/wiki/Balto "Balto") arrived in [Nome](/wiki/Nome,_Alaska "Nome, Alaska") at 5:30 a.m.

U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") signed into law an air mail bill popularly known as the Kelly Air Mail Act, which relieved the government of the responsibility for air mail.
sources: Trimble, William F. (1982). [*High Frontier: A History of Aeronautics in Pennsylvania*](https://archive.org/details/highfrontierhist00trim/page/128). Pittsburgh: University of Pittsburgh Press. p. [128](https://archive.org/details/highfrontierhist00trim/page/128). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-8229-5340-4](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-8229-5340-4 "Special:BookSources/0-8229-5340-4").

content: The fantasy adventure film *[The Lost World](/wiki/The_Lost_World_(1925_film) "The Lost World (1925 film)")* was released.

Catalog retailer [Sears, Roebuck, & Co.](/wiki/Sears,_Roebuck,_%26_Co. "Sears, Roebuck, & Co.") opened its first department store at [its headquarters](/wiki/Sears,_Roebuck_and_Company_Complex "Sears, Roebuck and Company Complex") in [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago "Chicago").
**Born:** [Elaine Stritch](/wiki/Elaine_Stritch "Elaine Stritch"), actress and singer, in [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit "Detroit") (d. 2014)
**Died:** [Jaap Eden](/wiki/Jaap_Eden "Jaap Eden"), 51, Dutch speed skater
The discovery of the [Taung Child](/wiki/Taung_Child "Taung Child") fossilized skull in [South Africa](/wiki/South_Africa "South Africa") the previous November was first publicized.
sources: "New "Missing Link's" Skull is Found in South African Wilds". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 4, 1925. p. 3.

content: The Bulgarian bank [Girdap](/wiki/Girdap "Girdap") declared bankruptcy.

**Born:** [John Fiedler](/wiki/John_Fiedler "John Fiedler"), actor, in [Platteville, Wisconsin](/wiki/Platteville,_Wisconsin "Platteville, Wisconsin") (d. 2005); [Leon Schlumpf](/wiki/Leon_Schlumpf "Leon Schlumpf"), politician, in [Felsberg, Switzerland](/wiki/Felsberg,_Switzerland "Felsberg, Switzerland") (d. 2012)
**Died:** [Oliver Heaviside](/wiki/Oliver_Heaviside "Oliver Heaviside"), 74, English mathematician

[Nels Nelsen](/wiki/Nels_Nelsen "Nels Nelsen") set a new world record for [ski jumping](/wiki/Ski_jumping "Ski jumping") with a leap of 240 feet (73.152 metres) in [Revelstoke, British Columbia](/wiki/Revelstoke,_British_Columbia "Revelstoke, British Columbia"). He was said to be sick with the flu when he made the jump.
sources: ["Ski Jumping"](http://vernonmuseum.ca/vernon-hall-of-fame/hof_ski_jumping.html). *The Greater Vernon Museum & Archives*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: The tunnel that was being used to reach trapped cave explorer [Floyd Collins](/wiki/Floyd_Collins "Floyd Collins") collapsed, requiring a new tunnel to be dug.
sources: ["Floyd Collins Museum"](http://www.atlasobscura.com/places/floyd-collins-museum). *Atlas Obscura*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Died:** [Robert Koldewey](/wiki/Robert_Koldewey "Robert Koldewey"), 69, German architect and archaeologist
10 people were arrested in the Soviet Union for conspiring to assassinate [Grigory Zinoviev](/wiki/Grigory_Zinoviev "Grigory Zinoviev").
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: Diplomatic relations between [Chile and Romania](/wiki/Chile-Romania_relations "Chile-Romania relations") were established.

[Prime Minister](/wiki/List_of_Prime_Ministers_of_Nepal "List of Prime Ministers of Nepal") [Chandra Shamsher Jang Bahadur Rana](/wiki/Chandra_Shamsher_Jang_Bahadur_Rana "Chandra Shamsher Jang Bahadur Rana") of [Nepal](/wiki/Nepal "Nepal") announced his intention to abolish slavery in the country.
sources: "Rajah of Nepal, India, to Free 51,419 Slaves". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 7, 1925. p. 1.

content: Former German Chancellor [Gustav Bauer](/wiki/Gustav_Bauer "Gustav Bauer") resigned his [Reichstag](/wiki/Reichstag_(Weimar_Republic) "Reichstag (Weimar Republic)") seat in disgrace over the [Barmat corruption scandal](/wiki/Barmat_scandal "Barmat scandal").
sources: Eekma, Bruce (2011). *A Daughter's Search for Her Father*. Bloomington, Indiana: iUniverse. p. 23. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-4620-5716-0](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4620-5716-0 "Special:BookSources/978-1-4620-5716-0").

content: Boxing champion [Jack Dempsey](/wiki/Jack_Dempsey "Jack Dempsey") and Hollywood film actress [Estelle Taylor](/wiki/Estelle_Taylor "Estelle Taylor") were married in a small ceremony in [San Diego](/wiki/San_Diego "San Diego").
sources: Shaffer, George (February 8, 1925). "Jack Dempsey and Estelle Taylor Wed". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Hans Schmidt](/wiki/Hans_Schmidt_(wrestler) "Hans Schmidt (wrestler)"), professional wrestler, in [Joliette](/wiki/Joliette "Joliette"), [Quebec](/wiki/Quebec "Quebec"), Canada (d. 2012)
The [Sheikh Said rebellion](/wiki/Sheikh_Said_rebellion "Sheikh Said rebellion") broke out in southeastern Turkey.

[Parliamentary elections](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Serbs,_Croats_and_Slovenes_parliamentary_election,_1925 "Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes parliamentary election, 1925") were held in the [Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Yugoslavia "Kingdom of Yugoslavia"). The [People's Radical Party](/wiki/People%27s_Radical_Party "People's Radical Party") remained the largest faction in [Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Yugoslavia "Parliament of Yugoslavia").
**Born:** [Jack Lemmon](/wiki/Jack_Lemmon "Jack Lemmon"), actor, in [Newton, Massachusetts](/wiki/Newton,_Massachusetts "Newton, Massachusetts") (d. 2001)
Germany presented a conciliatory memorandum to France proposing a mutual guarantee of the existing border between the two countries.
sources: Stolfi, R.H.S. (2011). *Hitler: Beyond Evil and Tyranny*. Amherst, New York: Prometheus Books. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-61614-474-6](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-61614-474-6 "Special:BookSources/978-1-61614-474-6").

content: The comedy play *[Loggerheads](/wiki/Loggerheads_(play) "Loggerheads (play)")* featuring [Whitford Kane](/wiki/Whitford_Kane "Whitford Kane") opened in New York City.
**Born:** [Vic Wertz](/wiki/Vic_Wertz "Vic Wertz"), baseball player, in [York, Pennsylvania](/wiki/York,_Pennsylvania "York, Pennsylvania") (d. 1983)
The U.S.-Canadian Fishing Agreement was signed, outlining fishing rights for the respective countries.
sources: ["Chronology 1925"](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Pierre Mondy](/wiki/Pierre_Mondy "Pierre Mondy"), actor and director, in [Neuilly-sur-Seine](/wiki/Neuilly-sur-Seine "Neuilly-sur-Seine"), Paris, France (d. 2012)
**Died:** [Aristide Bruant](/wiki/Aristide_Bruant "Aristide Bruant"), 73, French cabaret singer and nightclub owner
138 German miners were killed when the Stein mine in [Dortmund](/wiki/Dortmund "Dortmund") exploded.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (February 13, 1925). "Ruhr Revolt Near as 138 Die in Mine". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: In the [English House of Commons](/wiki/House_of_Commons_of_England "House of Commons of England"), [Reginald Applin](/wiki/Reginald_Applin "Reginald Applin") of the [Conservatives](/wiki/Conservative_Party_(UK) "Conservative Party (UK)") asked the [Speaker of the House](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_House_of_Commons_(United_Kingdom) "Speaker of the House of Commons (United Kingdom)") if [Labour](/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK) "Labour Party (UK)") MP [Ellen Wilkinson](/wiki/Ellen_Wilkinson "Ellen Wilkinson") was in order while addressing the House without wearing a hat. The Speaker ruled that she was and a precedent for women was set.
sources: "Bobbed Haired Woman Gets O.K. of Parliament". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 12, 1925. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Virginia E. Johnson](/wiki/Virginia_E._Johnson "Virginia E. Johnson"), sexologist, in [Springfield, Missouri](/wiki/Springfield,_Missouri "Springfield, Missouri") (d. 2013); [Kim Stanley](/wiki/Kim_Stanley "Kim Stanley"), actress, in [Tularosa, New Mexico](/wiki/Tularosa,_New_Mexico "Tularosa, New Mexico") (d. 2001)
**Died:** [H. E. Beunke](/wiki/Henri_Eduard_Beunke "Henri Eduard Beunke"), 73, Dutch writer
Thousands of miners around [Dortmund](/wiki/Dortmund "Dortmund") stopped work as both a sympathy gesture for the victims of the Stein mine explosion and a protest against dangerous mining conditions.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (February 13, 1925). "Ruhr Revolt Near as 138 Die in Mine". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") signed the [Federal Arbitration Act](/wiki/Federal_Arbitration_Act "Federal Arbitration Act") into law.

**Born:** [Lev Naumov](/wiki/Lev_Naumov "Lev Naumov"), classical pianist and composer, in [Rostov](/wiki/Rostov,_Yaroslavl_Oblast "Rostov, Yaroslavl Oblast"), [USSR](/wiki/Soviet_Union "Soviet Union") (d. 2005)

The [Judiciary Act of 1925](/wiki/Judiciary_Act_of_1925 "Judiciary Act of 1925"), also known as the Judge's Bill, was passed as an effort to reduce the workload of the [Supreme Court of the United States](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States "Supreme Court of the United States").
sources: ["Judiciary Act of 1925, 43 Stat. 936 (1925)"](https://web.archive.org/web/20150520030733/http://www.usconstitution.org/federal-judiciary/details/judiciary-act-of-1925-43-stat-936-1925). *usonstitution.org*. Archived from [the original](http://www.usconstitution.org/federal-judiciary/details/judiciary-act-of-1925-43-stat-936-1925) on May 20, 2015. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: [Floyd Collins](/wiki/Floyd_Collins "Floyd Collins") dies after being stuck in Sand Cave for over a week.
sources: ["Trapped! : The story of the struggle to rescue Floyd Collins from a Kentucky cave in 1925"](https://archive.org/details/trappedstoryofst0000murr/page/14/mode/2up). 1979.

content: [Paavo Nurmi](/wiki/Paavo_Nurmi "Paavo Nurmi") ran another record-breaking race in [Madison Square Garden](/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden_(1890) "Madison Square Garden (1890)") by running two miles in 8 minutes 58.2 seconds.
sources: "Nurmi Races Two Miles in Less Than 9 Minutes". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 15, 1925. p. Part 2 p. 1.

content: **Died:** [Arnold W. Brunner](/wiki/Arnold_W._Brunner "Arnold W. Brunner"), 67, American architect

The [Walt Disney](/wiki/Walt_Disney "Walt Disney") animated film short *[Alice Solves the Puzzle](/wiki/Alice_Solves_the_Puzzle "Alice Solves the Puzzle")* was released, introducing the character known as [Pete](/wiki/Pete_(Disney) "Pete (Disney)").
[Vitorino Guimarães](/wiki/Vitorino_Guimar%C3%A3es "Vitorino Guimarães") became [Prime Minister of Portugal](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Portugal "Prime Minister of Portugal").

[Willy Böckl](/wiki/Willy_B%C3%B6ckl "Willy Böckl") of Austria won the Men's Competition of the [World Figure Skating Championships](/wiki/1925_World_Figure_Skating_Championships "1925 World Figure Skating Championships") in [Vienna](/wiki/Vienna "Vienna").
The [London Zoo](/wiki/London_Zoo "London Zoo") announced it would install lights to cheer up the animals during London's foggy spells.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: **Died:** [Duke Farrell](/wiki/Duke_Farrell "Duke Farrell"), 58, American baseball player
Rescue diggers in Sand Cave, [Kentucky](/wiki/Kentucky "Kentucky") reached [Floyd Collins](/wiki/Floyd_Collins "Floyd Collins") at 2:45 in the afternoon and found him dead.
sources: "Cavern Grips Collins' Body". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 17, 1925. p. 1.

content: [Bavaria](/wiki/Bavaria "Bavaria") lifted the ban on the [Nazi Party](/wiki/Nazi_Party "Nazi Party") that was imposed after the [Beer Hall Putsch](/wiki/Beer_Hall_Putsch "Beer Hall Putsch").
sources: Tague, James E. (2011). *The Last Field Marshal*. Xlibris Corporation. p. 50. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-4568-3185-1](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1 "Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1").

content: **Born:** [Ed Emshwiller](/wiki/Ed_Emshwiller "Ed Emshwiller"), visual artist, in [Lansing, Michigan](/wiki/Lansing,_Michigan "Lansing, Michigan") (d. 1990); [Evelyn G. Lowery](/wiki/Evelyn_G._Lowery "Evelyn G. Lowery"), civil rights activist, in [Memphis, Tennessee](/wiki/Memphis,_Tennessee "Memphis, Tennessee") (d. 2013)

Ex-Prime Minister of the United Kingdom [H.H. Asquith](/wiki/H.H._Asquith "H.H. Asquith") took his seat in the [House of Lords](/wiki/House_of_Lords "House of Lords") as the Earl of Oxford and Asquith.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: **Born:** [Ron Goodwin](/wiki/Ron_Goodwin "Ron Goodwin"), composer and conductor, in [Plymouth](/wiki/Plymouth "Plymouth"), England (d. 2003); [Hal Holbrook](/wiki/Hal_Holbrook "Hal Holbrook"), actor, in [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland "Cleveland"), [Ohio](/wiki/Ohio "Ohio") (d. 2021)
U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") suggested that an international conference be held to set limits on the size of naval vessels.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: New Zealand's [rugby union](/wiki/Rugby_union "Rugby union") team defeated the visiting Canadian team from [Victoria, British Columbia](/wiki/Victoria,_British_Columbia "Victoria, British Columbia"), 68 to 4, in [Toulouse](/wiki/Toulouse "Toulouse"), France to complete a perfect 32–0 record in their [1924–25 tour](/wiki/1924%E2%80%9325_New_Zealand_rugby_union_tour_of_Britain,_Ireland_and_France "1924–25 New Zealand rugby union tour of Britain, Ireland and France") of Britain, Ireland and France. New Zealand scored a total of 838 points with only 116 points scored against them.
In a cricket match played in [Melbourne](/wiki/Melbourne "Melbourne"), the English team defeated Australia in the 4th Test for their first win against the Australians since 1912.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: **Born:** [George Kennedy](/wiki/George_Kennedy "George Kennedy"), actor, in New York City (d. 2016)
**Died:** [James Lane Allen](/wiki/James_Lane_Allen "James Lane Allen"), 75, American writer
A revised [International Opium Convention](/wiki/International_Opium_Convention "International Opium Convention") was signed in [Geneva](/wiki/Geneva "Geneva").
[Karakalpak Autonomous Oblast](/wiki/Karakalpak_Autonomous_Oblast "Karakalpak Autonomous Oblast") was created.
**Born:** [Jindřich Feld](/wiki/Jind%C5%99ich_Feld "Jindřich Feld"), composer, in [Prague](/wiki/Prague "Prague"), [Czechoslovakia](/wiki/Czechoslovakia "Czechoslovakia") (d. 2007)
A mine explosion in [Sullivan, Indiana](/wiki/Sullivan,_Indiana "Sullivan, Indiana") killed 51.
sources: ["The Day That Shook Sullivan, Indiana, in 1925"](http://indianadisasters.blogspot.ca/2014/05/the-day-that-shook-sullivan-indiana-in.html). *Indiana Disasters*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Robert Altman](/wiki/Robert_Altman "Robert Altman"), filmmaker, in [Kansas City, Missouri](/wiki/Kansas_City,_Missouri "Kansas City, Missouri") (d. 2006)

Bulgarian Prime Minister [Aleksandar Tsankov](/wiki/Aleksandar_Tsankov "Aleksandar Tsankov") declared a state of war throughout the country amid fighting between Bulgarian and Serbian irregulars attributed to communist agitators.
sources: "Red Rioting in Bulgaria Leads to Martial Law". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 22, 1925. p. 22.

content: This is the [cover date](/wiki/Cover_date "Cover date") of the very first issue of *[The New Yorker](/wiki/The_New_Yorker "The New Yorker")*, though not necessarily the publication date, as magazines usually date their covers ahead of time.
sources: Adams, Cecil (June 22, 1990). ["Why are magazines dated ahead of the time they actually appear?"](http://www.straightdope.com/columns/read/780/why-are-magazines-dated-ahead-of-the-time-they-actually-appear). *[The Straight Dope](/wiki/The_Straight_Dope "The Straight Dope")*. [Sun-Times Media Group](/wiki/Sun-Times_Media_Group "Sun-Times Media Group"). Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: A dynamite depot in Brazil exploded, killing 621.
sources: ["Explosion of a Dynamite Depot in Brazil"](http://disastrous-accidents.silk.co/page/Explosion-of-a-dynamite-depot-in-Brazil). *Disastrous Accidents*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Sam Peckinpah](/wiki/Sam_Peckinpah "Sam Peckinpah"), film director and screenwriter, in [Fresno, California](/wiki/Fresno,_California "Fresno, California") (d. 1984)
The [Chamber of Deputies](/wiki/Chamber_of_Deputies_(France) "Chamber of Deputies (France)") in France voted against keeping a French embassy in the Vatican.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 327. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: The [Polish Ice Hockey Federation](/wiki/Polish_Ice_Hockey_Federation "Polish Ice Hockey Federation") was founded.
**Born:** [Maddy English](/wiki/Maddy_English "Maddy English"), baseball player, in [Everett, Massachusetts](/wiki/Everett,_Massachusetts "Everett, Massachusetts") (d. 2004)
The film *[Lady of the Night](/wiki/Lady_of_the_Night_(1925_film) "Lady of the Night (1925 film)")*, starring [Norma Shearer](/wiki/Norma_Shearer "Norma Shearer"), was released.
**Died:** [Samuel Berger](/wiki/Samuel_Berger_(boxer) "Samuel Berger (boxer)"), 50, Olympic gold medalist boxer

The United States and Canada signed the [Lake of the Woods](/wiki/Lake_of_the_Woods "Lake of the Woods") Treaties, defining the lake's boundary line more accurately, regulating its water level, and arranging for the settlement of port damages caused by overflowing that arose from work done on the Canadian side.
sources: "U.S. and Canada Sign Lake of the Woods Treaties". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 25, 1925. p. 11.

content: **Born:** [Lynn Chandnois](/wiki/Lynn_Chandnois "Lynn Chandnois"), American football player, in [Fayette, Michigan](/wiki/Fairbanks_Township,_Michigan "Fairbanks Township, Michigan") (d. 2011)

**Died:** [Hjalmar Branting](/wiki/Hjalmar_Branting "Hjalmar Branting"), 64, [Prime Minister of Sweden](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Sweden "Prime Minister of Sweden") and recipient of the [Nobel Peace Prize](/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize "Nobel Peace Prize")

The [Guna](/wiki/Kuna_people "Kuna people") Revolution broke out in [Panama](/wiki/Panama "Panama") when chiefs [Nele Kantule](/wiki/Nele_Kantule "Nele Kantule") and Ologintipipilele led attacks on police on the islands of Tupile and Ukupseni.
sources: Woods, Sarah (2005). [*Panama: The Bradt Travel Guide*](https://archive.org/details/panama00sara/page/293). Guildford, Connecticut: Bradt Travel Guides Ltd. p. [293](https://archive.org/details/panama00sara/page/293). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [1-84162-117-X](/wiki/Special:BookSources/1-84162-117-X "Special:BookSources/1-84162-117-X").

content: **Born:** [Shehu Shagari](/wiki/Shehu_Shagari "Shehu Shagari"), 6th [President of Nigeria](/wiki/President_of_Nigeria "President of Nigeria"), in [Shagari](/wiki/Shagari,_Nigeria "Shagari, Nigeria") (d. 2018)

**Died:** [Louis Feuillade](/wiki/Louis_Feuillade "Louis Feuillade"), 52, French film director; [Joseph M. McCormick](/wiki/Joseph_M._McCormick "Joseph M. McCormick"), 47, American businessman and politician (suicide)
A major [Wahhabi](/wiki/Wahhabi "Wahhabi") raid was carried out across the border of [Transjordan](/wiki/Emirate_of_Transjordan "Emirate of Transjordan").
sources: "Report Wahabis Kill 1,000 in Trans-Jordania". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 27, 1925. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Everton Weekes](/wiki/Everton_Weekes "Everton Weekes"), cricketer, in [Saint Michael, Barbados](/wiki/Saint_Michael,_Barbados "Saint Michael, Barbados") (d. 2020)

The legally reinstated [Nazi Party](/wiki/Nazi_Party "Nazi Party") held a convention in the same hall in [Munich](/wiki/Munich "Munich") where [Adolf Hitler](/wiki/Adolf_Hitler "Adolf Hitler") had launched his failed [putsch](/wiki/Beer_Hall_Putsch "Beer Hall Putsch"). Hitler made his first speech since his release from prison to a packed audience of over 4,000 in the hall as another 1,000 stood outside.
sources: Tague, James E. (2011). *The Last Field Marshal*. Xlibris Corporation. p. 50. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-4568-3185-1](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1 "Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1").

Giblin, James Cross (2002). [*The Life and Death of Adolf Hitler*](https://archive.org/details/lifedeathofado00gibl/page/48). Clarion Books. p. [48](https://archive.org/details/lifedeathofado00gibl/page/48). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-395-90371-8](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-395-90371-8 "Special:BookSources/0-395-90371-8").

content: **Born:** [Samuel Dash](/wiki/Samuel_Dash "Samuel Dash"), professor of law and chief counsel for the [Senate Watergate Committee](/wiki/Senate_Watergate_Committee "Senate Watergate Committee"), in [Camden, New Jersey](/wiki/Camden,_New_Jersey "Camden, New Jersey") (d. 2004)
The [Charlevoix–Kamouraska earthquake](/wiki/1925_Charlevoix%E2%80%93Kamouraska_earthquake "1925 Charlevoix–Kamouraska earthquake") struck northeastern North America.
**Died:** [Friedrich Ebert](/wiki/Friedrich_Ebert "Friedrich Ebert"), 54, [President of Germany](/wiki/President_of_Germany "President of Germany")
